channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023090142
item.description:
Report E-2023090142

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 7, 2023, at 0815 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Circle K Landstar personnel in Cincinnati, Ohio regarding the release of approximately 40 gallons of Perchlorethylene (Tetrachloroethylene (Marine pollutant), UN18976.1, III). The release was contained to the trailer floor and asphalt beneath the trailer. Terminal personnel felt comfortable cleaning up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was staged onsite pending the shipper's disposition and pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023081635
item.description:
Report X-2023081635

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: CHILLICOTHE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver noticed the package was leaking and requested help from QA. Gloves, goggles, and aprons were acquired and moved the package into a line tote. Package was then transported to an isolated location. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered that there was no inner packaging and a lid of one of the bottles had come off causing the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined tote upright and moved to a hazmat area.

DescribePack: upon inspection found that one of the lids was loose allowing contents to leak throughout box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: jugs were placed upright in tote and lids were tightened

item.title: Report X-2023081104
item.description:
Report X-2023081104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazardous material drum was being unloaded off of a P&D vehicle, when a package handler noticed liquid gathering at the rim of the closure. The package handler did not touch the drum and immediately brought to the attention of a QA Admin and Ops Manager. Proper PPE was obtained, and the drum was moved to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid of the drum was improperly sealed or was not the correct size. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The drum was immediately moved to a flat surface away from the operation.

item.title: Report X-2023080838
item.description:
Report X-2023080838

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: HAZMAT WAS REPACKED AT PREVIOUS LOCATION IN AN IMPROPER SIZED BOX AND INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWING MOVEMENT ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR FROM DESPENSE CAP. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.
